description:
As a Data Steward, you will be part of the Data team to architect and implement a data management framework across Google Cloud Customer team business functions. You will manage governed data within the business unit, while ensuring the highest level of data quality, consistency, accuracy, and reliability through policies, standards, and procedures. You will also be responsible for understanding metadata, usage, standards, and quality for critical data elements required for the business.

In this role, you will work closely with the business stakeholders, business process managers and Google Cloud Engineering teams to review/define data requirements for the business area, prioritize and drive data initiatives across multiple systems, manage and govern data pipelines to facilitate key metrics reporting, define road-maps for execution, and maintain/manage the data quality. Additionally, you will be accountable for the overall health of data and data issue management for our Partner business function and for managing vendor teams in order to execute on the data strategy for the business function.

Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelors degree, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of related experience in data quality, data stewardship and data governance.
  • Data analysis and SQL experience.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with project management.
  • Understanding of data architecture and management concepts.
  • Familiarity with Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems, data warehouses and other data repositories and environments.
  • Familiarity with sales business processes.
  • Ability to support multiple data-centric projects in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
  • Effective agreement building, influencing, and partnership skills.
responsibilities:
• Support the business in understanding the Data Strategy and road map to align their projects and strategies to the new ecosystem.
  • Serve as a key liaison with external data enrichment vendors for ongoing data enhancement and augmentation efforts.
  • Participate in operational strategy forums and technical project lifecycle forums to verify data considerations, properly support the Data Strategy and streamline the data solutions across the organization.
  • Serve as a primary point of escalation within a business function to resolve data quality issues. Provide guidance within the business unit on information sourcing, provisioning, consumption, standardization, and reporting and analytics
  • Clearly understand data quality dimensions, data profiling, data tracing, metadata management, lineage, data quality business rules, the discipline of data quality testing and of root cause analysis for issue management and resolution.
title: Data Steward, Sales, Cloud Business Transformation Organization
